tombstone.item.scroll_buff.use1: Right click on a grave's soul to activate
tombstone.item.scroll_buff.use2: Hold right click to cast this spell

Allows you to see your grave at a distance
Recover your lost items by right clicking on your grave or sneaking over it
tombstone.item.grave_key.desc2:
Allows you to teleport to your grave
Recover your lost items by right clicking on your grave or sneaking over it

tombstone.item.grave_key.use2: Hold right click to teleport to your grave

The grave magic makes this fishing rod faster and unbreakable
tombstone.item.lost_tablet.desc1: This tablet must have possessed a great power long ago
tombstone.item.lost_tablet.desc2: Seems to depict a distant place

tombstone.item.soul_receptacle.use1: The magic of this item prevents you from dying when in your inventory

tombstone.item.familiar_receptacle.use1: The imprisoned soul must recover by absorbing some of your vital essence

tombstone.item.voodoo_poppet.use1: Add protections in the crafting table
tombstone.item.voodoo_poppet.use2: Right click on a grave's soul to seal the protections
tombstone.item.voodoo_poppet.use3: This poppet is active and prevents certain types of death

tombstone.item.book_of_disenchantment.us: Right click on a grave's soul with an enchanted item in your offhand
tombstone.item.ankh_of_pray.desc: Allows you to pray for your soul on graves

tombstone.command.tbshowlastgrave.usage:
Shows the position of the last known grave of a player
/tbshowlastgrave [player]
tombstone.command.tbteleportgrave.usage:
Teleports to the last known grave of a player
/tbteleportgrave [player] [playerGrave]
tombstone.command.tbteleporthome.usage:
Teleports to the respawn point of a player
/tbteleporthome [player] [target]
tombstone.command.tbrestoreinventory.usa:
Restores the player inventory with the last known grave
/tbrestoreinventory [player]
tombstone.command.tbknowledge.usage:
Adjusts the Knowledge of Death of a player
/tbknowledge <player> <show|set|give|remove> <amount>
tombstone.command.tbsiege.usage:
Launches a village siege in the chosen dimension or your current one
/tbsiege [dim]
tombstone.command.tbrevivefamiliar.usage:
Revives the last dead familiar of a player
/tbrevivefamiliar <player>
tombstone.command.tbacceptteleport.usage: This command shouldn't be called manually
tombstone.command.tbrequestteleport.usag:
Send authorization request to teleport to another player
/tbrequestteleport <player>
tombstone.command.tbteleportdeath.usage:
Teleports to your last death location
/tbteleportdeath
tombstone.command.tbbind.usage:
Binds your current location or teleport to one of 5 possible bound locations
/tbbind <show|set [1-5]|teleport [1-5]>
tombstone.compendium.main.title: Compendium
tombstone.compendium.main.desc:
The Compendium is a collection of information about Tombstone to help new players.
Each information is linked to several others in the right hand menu for a consistent reading.
tombstone.compendium.alignment.title: Alignment
tombstone.compendium.alignment.desc:
The alignment depends on the actions made by the player.
It can unlock some perks or allow to use some magical items.
Each level of alignment also reduces the damage done by undead / living creatures depending on your side of alignment.
The damage reduction does not affect those of others players.
tombstone.compendium.ankh_of_pray.desc:
The Ã‚nkh of Pray is an item allowing to earn Knowledge of Death but with a cooldown.
When the object is usable, it can be used to pray near a Decorative Tomb (1 point) also giving a chance to receive a beneficial effect (config + level in Knowledge of Death), or to exorcise a zombie-villager ( 3 points).
It can also be used to reset your assigned Perks by using it on a Grave's Soul.
tombstone.compendium.bone_needle.desc: The bone needle is a tool used to create a magical bind with a creature by capturing a small part of its essence. The needle once filled with this essence can modify an impregnated diamond before using it in more complex recipes like the familiar receptacle.
tombstone.compendium.book_of_disenchantm:
The book can extract enchantments from an item when in contact with a Grave's Soul.
The object to be disenchanted must be held in your left hand.
The Perk Disenchanter allows you to remove one more enchantment by level.
tombstone.compendium.contributor.title: Contributor
tombstone.compendium.contributor.desc:
In order to thank the contributors of Tombstone, some bonuses are active in the game concerning them.
You can become a contributor for a while by performing translations or reporting issues.
These bonuses may vary over time, the currents being :
- the cooldown duration of the Ã‚nkh of Pray is reduced by 50%%
- lollipops can be found on mobs even if it's not Halloween
- magic scroll duration is increased by 30%%
- an additional model for your favorite grave
- Plague Bringer can be used safely without a bad alignment
tombstone.compendium.grave_marble.desc:
The Grave Marble is a block created from Grave's Dust and Stone, and used to craft Decorative Graves.
It's also possible to craft White Marble by adding Bone Meal to the recipe.
The Grave Marble is really resistant to explosions.
tombstone.compendium.death.title: Die in Tombstone
tombstone.compendium.death.desc:
When a player dies, a grave is created containing all lost items.
The player reappears with the Grave's Key allowing to teleport if enchanted, as well as a Ghostly Shape effect preventing creatures from attacking you.
The amount of experience lost is defined in the config and adjusted by the Perk Memento Mori by 20 %% per level allowing to reach 100 %%.
tombstone.compendium.decorative_grave.de:
Decorative Graves are special blocks that emit smoke at night.
They can be made from Dark Marble and any Skull, and can be harvested with a pickaxe or shovel.
You can engrave them with an Anvil and an Iron Ingot, and by replacing the actual name with a new one.
The Decorative Graves are sometimes haunted by a soul (defined by the config) that can be used to enchant certain magical items such as the Grave's Key, Scrolls and Tablets.
The chance to have a soul on a decorative grave is not influenced if the chunk is unloaded.
tombstone.compendium.dust_of_vanishing.d:
The Dust of Vanishing is created from Grave's Dust and Gunpowder.
It allows an easy retreat by disappearing from the eyes of creatures in a cloud of smoke, and reappearing a few steps behind your old position.
tombstone.compendium.enchantments.title: Enchantments
tombstone.compendium.enchantments.desc:
Â§nSoulboundÂ§r: items with this enchantment remain on you when you die
Â§nShadow StepÂ§r: you move discreetly reducing the distance to be detected by creatures.
Distance is affected by day, level of enchantment and whether the player is crouched.
Â§nMagic SiphonÂ§r: each hit on a creature has a chance, depending on the level of the enchantment, to steal a magical effect from the creature (potions count as magical effect).
Â§nPlague BringerÂ§r: each hit on a creature has a chance to apply a random harmful effect. The wearer is also affects by this effect if his alignment is not bad(configurable). This enchantment is incompatible with Magic Siphon and is not available at the Enchanting Table.
tombstone.compendium.familiar_receptacle:
This receptacle can not be created without a high Knowledge of Death.
It can capture the soul of one of your dead familiar and all its possessions.
The soul contained in the receptacle must then recover by slowly absorbing the vital essence of the wearer.
The most common use of the receptacle is to bring this familiar back to life by praying with the Ã‚nkh.
The required level to craft a familiar receptacle can be defined in config.
tombstone.compendium.fishing_rod_of_misa:
This fishing rod seems to be bad luck fishing.
Enchanting the item with a Grave's Soul seems to worsen this bad luck.
tombstone.compendium.ghostly_shape.desc:
The Ghostly Shape is an effect received after a death that prevents creatures from attacking you.
It can be improved with the Perk Ghostly Shape granting some additional effects.
The effect is canceled if you attack a creature or retrieve your grave.
If the config restricts Ghostly Shape, the effect will also be canceled if you open a chest, break a block, or push a hostile creature.
tombstone.compendium.grave_dust.desc:
The Grave's Dust is a crafting ingredient used in several recipes such as Dark Marble, Scrolls and Tablets.
It can be dropped from the undead creatures and more rarely when the lost tablets break.
tombstone.compendium.grave_key.desc:
After you reappear from a death, you receive the Grave's Key.
This allows you to locate your grave at a distance when you are in the same dimension.
The key can be enchanted with a Soul haunting a Decorative Grave, or by crafting, allowing you to teleport directly to your grave.
The key has a chance to be directly enchanted defined in the config and adjusted by the Perk Jailer of 20 %% per level to reach 100 %%.
tombstone.compendium.impregnated_diamond:
Impregnated Diamond is a crafting ingredient made from a diamond and some Grave's Dusts.
It's used to create some receptacles.
tombstone.compendium.halloween.title: Halloween
tombstone.compendium.halloween.desc:
During Halloween, being also the Sabbat period, some Tombstone behaviors will be altered:
- decorative Graves have special decorations
- grave's keys are always enchanted when respawning from a death, and you also receive ghostly shape 5 (if the duration in the config is above 0)
- magic scroll duration is increased by 50%%
- voodoo poppet & book of disenchantment don't require the need of the corresponding Perk
- pray on a Decorative Grave always provides a buff
- if the config is set to have losses in the grave, some lollipops are put in replacement instead of junk items
- the Perk Bone Collector is increased by 2
- if the config for spawn creatures on grave recovery is enabled, the creatures will spawn with pumkin head
- ghosts appears during night to haunt players that don't pray on graves
The Knowledge of Death is a list of unlockable Perks by progressing in by various ways:
- with the Ankh of Pray
- by completing the advancements of Tombstone
- by enchanting items with Decorative Graves
- by releasing a Soul from a Soul Receptacle.
The Knowledge of Death also increases the minimum time without sleeping for phantom to spawn near player by 10%% for each level (if the config allows it)
tombstone.compendium.lollipop.desc:
Halloween lollipops provide a random benefit.
It is possible to configure the effects that should not be granted in the config.
tombstone.compendium.lost_tablet.desc:
These tablets tend to be found by unlucky fishermen.
First, they must recover their energy by absorbing slowly the vital essence of the wearer.
Then, they can lead to remote villages, or rarer structures, or even in other worlds if config allows it.
The Perk Treasure Seeker allows you to find rare structures more often.
Enhance the tablet with a Grave's Grave can teleport to this place.
tombstone.compendium.magic_items.title: Magic Items
tombstone.compendium.magic_items.desc: Most Tombstone items can be enchanted with the help of Grave's Soul that are haunting randomly Decorative Graves, by using the item on the grave with a right click.
tombstone.compendium.magic_scrolls.title: Magic Scrolls
tombstone.compendium.magic_scrolls.desc:
Magical Scrolls are made from Strange Scroll. Once enchanted with a Grave's Soul, they can provide an effect by holding the right mouse button, destroying the scroll at the same time.
The duration of the scrolls can be defined in config.
tombstone.compendium.magic_tablets.title: Magic Tablets
tombstone.compendium.magic_tablets.desc:
Magic tablets are made from Strange Tablet.
Once enchanted, they allow to teleport in various ways.
In ancient time, tablets had the ability to transport multiple creatures, but not one remembers the secret of their creation.
tombstone.compendium.perk.title: Perks
tombstone.compendium.perk.desc: Perks are bonuses related to the Tombstone features that can be obtained with your Knowledge of Death points.
tombstone.compendium.scroll_of_feather_f: This scroll gives you an effect slowing down your falls.
tombstone.compendium.scroll_of_knowledge:
This scroll is used to preserve your experience.
When you make contact with a Grave's Soul, all your experience will be drained by the scroll.
Use again the scroll will restore this experience.
tombstone.compendium.scroll_of_preservat:
This scroll gives you an effect to keep your beneficial effects after a death.
It is possible to configure the effects that should not be restored in the config.
tombstone.compendium.scroll_of_purificat: This scroll gives you an effect to remove your negative effects throughout its duration.
tombstone.compendium.scroll_of_true_sigh:
This scroll lets you in the dark, in the fog and under the water.
It also reveals invisible creatures.
tombstone.compendium.scroll_of_unstable_: This scroll gives you an effect making you invulnerable for a full second every 5 seconds.
tombstone.compendium.scroll_of_reach.des: This scroll gives you an effect increasing the range to hit creatures or to harvest.
tombstone.compendium.soul.title: Grave's Soul
tombstone.compendium.soul.desc:
Some souls are sometimes condemned to wander the world of mortals, and end up haunting places like Decorative Graves.
These souls can help you by enchanting some of your magical items freeing them from their eternal condemnation.
It's possible to find them trapped in a Soul Receptacle.
tombstone.compendium.soul_receptacle.des:
Some stories say that necromancers sometimes imprison souls in a receptacle to prevent them from dying.
Make freedom to these souls by bringing them back to a Decorative Grave gives 10 Death Knowledge Points.
It is possible to find out on undead bosses.
tombstone.compendium.special_bonus.title: Special Bonuses
tombstone.compendium.special_bonus.desc: Some bonuses are awarded at certain times of the year and other reasons necessary for the continuity of Tombstone.
tombstone.compendium.strange_scroll.desc: The strange scrolls are made from Grave's Dust, Paper and Sticks. They are used to craft Magic Scrolls.
tombstone.compendium.strange_tablet.desc: Strange tablets are made from Grave's Dust and Dark Marble. They are used to craft Magic Tablets.
tombstone.compendium.tablet_of_assistanc:
The Tablet of Assistance allows you to teleport to a player.
For this, it must be enchanted with a Grave's Soul and then the name of the player must be engraved with the Anvil and a Grave's Dust.
tombstone.compendium.tablet_of_home.desc: The Tablet of Home allows you to teleport to your respawn point.
tombstone.compendium.tablet_of_recall.de: The Tablet of Recall allows you to teleport to a Decorative Grave.
The Tablet of Cupidity allows you to teleport to places where fortune could smile at you, but also bring your loss.
tombstone.compendium.voodoo_poppet.desc: The Voodoo Poppet helps to protect against certain types of death.
